p: Only a small percentage of patients develops a severe form of the disease including: ocular disease with retinal lesions (0.5–2 % of patients); meningo-encephalitis (< 1 %) with headache, loss of memory, confusion, convulsions, and coma; hemorrhagic fever (< 1 %) starting with severe liver impairment, jaundice, followed by hemorrhage, vomiting blood, melena, purpuric rash, nose and gums bleedings, or menorrhagia. Hemorrhagic forms have a case-fatality as high as 50 %. The virus may be detected in blood for up to ten days.
